page.title: 09WILDLIFE OF BEDGEBURY AREA
page.content: The fauna and flora of the Bedgebury area are very varied as is expected in a large area of mixed woodland. There have been recorded by Mr Fuller, the Forestry Commission Head Ranger in this area, some 75 different species of birds, 11 of butterflies, and 20 of animals and reptiles, as well as numerous species of trees, flowers and grasses. Mr Fuller's job involves keeping watch on all forms of wildlife in Bedgebury and, where necessary, controlling their numbers in order to protect the tree crops from damage which could eventually result in loss of revenue to the Forestry Commission. Control methods include trapping, shooting and ferreting, and are aimed at two major species, Grey Squirrel and Common Rabbit, which are the major damage causers.
